Most people agree that we need common sense gun reform. So why hasn't Congress taken action? Hint: the @NRA. 

Real reform means standing up to the @NRA, and the politicians who do their bidding. 

Today, I’m taking a stand against gun violence by signing the #NoNRAmoney pledge.

I went to the memorial for victims of the Las Vegas mass killing last night. We have a broken political system that is not solving the epidemic of gun violence. The Parkland students are right: Vote like your lives depend on it.

One year ago, 58 were killed and over 400 wounded in Las Vegas.

Since then, more mass shootings have killed hundreds and wounded thousands. And Congress does absolutely nothing — unable to pass any common sense gun safety legislation.

Enough is enough.  Time for a new Congress.
